Name: Lukas
Comment: Nice, I like it a lot! The visualization of penguin population trends really helped me understand the impact of climate change.

Name: Emma
Comment: Fascinating data on penguin species distribution. I never realized how much the Adelie penguins dominate in terms of population. Great work on presenting complex information in an accessible way!

Name: Raj
Comment: The comparison between wild and zoo penguin populations was eye-opening. It's reassuring to see so many penguins still in their natural habitats.

Name: Sophie
Comment: I'm concerned about the declining Emperor penguin numbers. Are there any ongoing conservation efforts specifically for this species?

Name: Chen
Comment: The interactive maps are fantastic! It's interesting to see how different species are distributed across various Antarctic sites.

Name: Olivia
Comment: As a data scientist, I appreciate the use of linear regression to predict future trends. Have you considered using more advanced machine learning models?

Name: Mohammed
Comment: The section on climate change impacts was sobering. It's clear we need urgent action to protect these amazing birds and their habitats.

Name: Isabella
Comment: Love the penguin joke! ðŸ˜‚ But seriously, this dashboard is both informative and engaging. Great job!

Name: Ethan
Comment: I'm a biology teacher and this will be an excellent resource for my class on ecosystems. Thanks for making complex data so accessible!

Name: Aisha
Comment: The fact about penguin huddles reaching 19 birds per square meter blew my mind! Nature is truly amazing.
